reviews.title: nice but noisy

reviews.text: We went out around 8pm and the bar below the hotel was dead so we thought we were safe. Arrived back at half 11 to very crowded street, bikes everywhere. My boyfriend passed out so was unable to hear the noise of the music and drone of bass, by 2 am it was unbearable and I was unable to sleep, longing for 4am when it would stop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FROM AND TO SCHIPOL: From Schipol the cheapest and very easy way is just catch the train to central station (tickets are in the luggage rooms, you may do it while you wait for your luggage) and from Central Station the Tram 1-2-5 go to the corner of Marnikstraat at Leidsplein and from there is a 1 minute walk to the door of the hotel.
reviews.title: Big rooms, near the night-life attractions
Loved it! Even the steep stairs were great!
reviews.text: LOCATION: The location is excellent, within the cool night district of Leidsplein were small trendy design bars are populated mostly with 20+ (year old) customers; the hotel itself sits above the Weber bar were the decoration concept one can find in the rooms is extended to the next level. In spite the location within this known night-life district the neighbourhood is very quiet and depending on your room, if you open the windows in the most busy nights you may perhaps hear some noise but that really didn’t disturbed us; they have disposable ear-plugs on the night-stand in case it gets to bother you. For who wants to visit the city the location is no less then excellent since it is within the Southern Canal Belt, from where you do your errands around the city heart by foot (or bike or boat if you will) and get everywhere in a 10 minute walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: STAFF: People are not always in the reception but from your room you can dial and the calls are redirected to the staff mobile phone which is usually 5 minute away and happy to help you. Cards for the rooms and main door are given and because breakfast are eaten in our room you likely go by days without seeing no other guests or staff. It is basically like being in an apartment but rooms are daily cleaned and refreshed and always spotless.
reviews.title: Really good hotel - Small details

reviews.text: THE HOTEL AND ROOMS: As I read in Lonely Planet, once you accepted you are going to stay in a small room for a lot of money you are ready to stay in Amsterdam, rooms are small and often even cramped. These were very spacious for what I could understand. Each room is different! They are plain but stylishly decorated in a minimal style with some oriental / ethnic and baroque notes. Loved it! The bathroom has a curtain shower and no stand, is just the plain floor. Hygiene products are, as advertised in hotel website from Rituals Home; they have hairdryer. At least our room had a small balcony with 2 chairs where after firmly closing the door to avoid the smoke to enter the room (this is a smoke-fee hotel!) we’d sometimes enjoy a cigarette; otherwise there is a retractable wooden bench in the street at the window of the bar were you can have your morning coffee (see ahead for the coffee item) and smoke. The bed is very comfortable and rooms have security safes. In each room, a small sink with and an electric cup where you can make tea available also from Home Rituals.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights for my husbands birthday. We've been to Amsterdam on several occasions and have yet to find a hotel that we would want to return to. The city is wonderful, romantic and fun. The Weber is located on a busy road but we requested a high room at the back side which we got and so we had no problem with noise, I wouldn't like to stay at the front.
reviews.title: All positive but at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large (unusually so for the dam) clean, modern (really nice lights), nice bathroom and toiletries and had a fridge stocked each day, breakfast was ideal for us. I guess my only negative is the price as it's more a serviced apartment block than a hotel and you are completely left on your own. This suits us fine, but we weren't even told how to operate the coffee machine so service wasn't great. 150 euros a night is expensive (especially with the strength of the pound at the moment), so I guess a few extra touches would have been nice. The towels aren't great, and perhaps a beer in the fridge would have been a nice touch as no hotel bar or mini bar.
reviews.title: Amazing Place!

likes.disliked: — The stairs..but no hotel in Amsterdam is different, so no complaints there..

reviews.text: I would have no hesitation at staying here again, but feel the price should be nearer the 100 euro mark.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Weber is the best kept secret in Amsterdam! Don't hesitate - just make your reservation because this place is perfect. My husband and I have stayed here twice, and will make sure to stay here again for all future stays in Amsterdam. I actually don't like the intrusiveness of normal B&Bs so don't normally stay at them (I don't like eating breakfast with a crazy cat lady! I like my privacy) - but this is really just a tiny hotel, not a B&B so no need to worry. The manager of this hotel is terrific - young and energetic, and gives you his number to call his cell day or night with any questions! The rooms are truly *huge* by Dutch standards. The rooms are immaculately clean, and the breakfast of bread with yummies in the fridge in the room is so good (and authentically Dutch). The free wireless internet is super fast and reliable. Ultra modern shower and decor, sink area with espresso coffee and a fridge, a flat screen TV with cable. There is literally nothing I would suggest this hotel changes - I love it here, and will continue to tell all my friends and family. Great value, so clean, and so modern. (Also, I read another review complaining incorrectly about this - they will indeed give you the bread the night before if you're going to be up and out early in the morning - you just need to ask.)
reviews.title: Hotel Weber: What a Wonderful Gem!
Hotel Weber
reviews.text: As background - my husband and I are both in our early 30s and are busy professionals, who travel quite a lot, and normally stay at upscale hotels. (And he's Dutch, I'm American, and we live in the US.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About the stairs - come on now, this is Amsterdam and steep stairs are part of the experience! If you want to be insulated from "real" Dutch housing, stay at a boring Marriott and eat at McDonalds. If you want to feel like you've got your own fabulous apartment right in the city, with real Dutch hospitality (and real Dutch food for breakfast!), this is the place to be!
reviews.title: Just all right and beware of the stairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel having seen the positive reviews on here and were not disappointed. We paid £316 for a double room for 4 nights and it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.text: Our room was number 6 which was up three steep flights of stairs. These stairs were the only downside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Highly highly recommended!!
